MemberSignature.Value: public void ContinueAsNew (object input, bool preserveUnprocessedEvents = false);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ContinueAsNew(object input, bool preserveUnprocessedEvents) cil managed
Public Sub ContinueAsNew (input As Object, Optional preserveUnprocessedEvents As Boolean = false)
abstract member ContinueAsNew : obj * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON-serializeable data to re-initialize the instance with.

If set to true, re-adds any unprocessed external events into the new execution history when the orchestration instance restarts. If false, any unprocessed external events will be discarded when the orchestration instance restarts.
Docs.summary: Restarts the orchestration by clearing its history.

remarks.para: Large orchestration histories can consume a lot of memory and cause delays in instance load times. This method can be used to periodically truncate the stored history of an orchestration instance.
Note that any unprocessed external events will be discarded when an orchestration instance restarts itself using this method.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task CreateTimer (DateTime fireAt, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancelToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task CreateTimer(valuetype System.DateTime fireAt, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancelToken) cil managed
Public Function CreateTimer (fireAt As DateTime, cancelToken As CancellationToken) As Task
abstract member CreateTimer : DateTime * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: The time at which the timer should expire.
The CancellationToken to use for cancelling the timer.
Docs.summary: Creates a durable timer that expires at a specified time.
Docs.returns: A durable task that completes when the durable timer expires.
Docs.remarks: All durable timers created using this method must either expire or be cancelled using the before the orchestrator function completes. Otherwise the underlying framework will keep the instance in the "Running" state even after the orchestrator function has completed.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<T> CreateTimer<T> (DateTime fireAt, T state, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancelToken);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<!!T> CreateTimer<T>(valuetype System.DateTime fireAt, !!T state, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancelToken) cil managed

abstract member CreateTimer : DateTime * 'T * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<'T>

Docs.param: The time at which the timer should expire.
Any state to be preserved by the timer.
The CancellationToken to use for cancelling the timer.
Docs.summary: Creates a durable timer that expires at a specified time.
Docs.returns: A durable task that completes when the durable timer expires.
Docs.remarks: All durable timers created using this method must either expire or be cancelled using the before the orchestrator function completes. Otherwise the underlying framework will keep the instance in the "Running" state even after the orchestrator function has completed.

MemberSignature.Value: public DateTime CurrentUtcDateTime { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.DateTime CurrentUtcDateTime
Public ReadOnly Property CurrentUtcDateTime As DateTime
member this.CurrentUtcDateTime : DateTime

Docs.summary: Gets the current date/time in a way that is safe for use in orchestrations and entity operations.
Docs.value: The orchestration or entity's current date/time in UTC.
Docs.remarks: This date/time value is derived from the orchestration or entity history. It always returns the same value at specific points in the orchestrator function code, making it deterministic and safe for replay.

Docs.typeparam: Any data contract type that matches the JSON input.
Docs.summary: Gets the input of the current orchestrator function as a deserialized value.
Docs.returns: The deserialized input value.

MemberSignature.Value: public string InstanceId { get; }
.property instance string InstanceId
Public ReadOnly Property InstanceId As String
member this.InstanceId : string

Docs.summary: Gets the instance ID of the currently executing orchestration.
Docs.value: The ID of the current orchestration instance.
Docs.remarks: The instance ID is generated and fixed when the orchestrator function is scheduled. It can be either auto-generated, in which case it is formatted as a GUID, or it can be user-specified with any format.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsLocked (out System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList<Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.EntityId> ownedLocks);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsLocked([out] class System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList`1<valuetype Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.EntityId>& ownedLocks) cil managed
Public Function IsLocked (ByRef ownedLocks As IReadOnlyList(Of EntityId)) As Boolean
abstract member IsLocked : IReadOnlyList -> bool

Docs.param: The collection of owned locks.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current context is locked, and if so, what locks are currently owned.
Docs.returns: true if the context already holds some locks.
Docs.remarks: Note that the collection of owned locks can be empty even if the context is locked. This happens if an orchestration calls a suborchestration without lending any locks.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsReplaying { get; }
.property instance bool IsReplaying
Public ReadOnly Property IsReplaying As Boolean
member this.IsReplaying : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the orchestration or operation is currently replaying itself.
Docs.value: true if the orchestration or operation is currently being replayed; otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: This property is useful when there is logic that needs to run only when *not* replaying. For example, certain types of application logging may become too noisy when duplicated as part of replay. The application code could check to see whether the function is being replayed and then issue the log statements when this value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<IDisposable> LockAsync (params Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.EntityId[] entities);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class System.IDisposable> LockAsync(valuetype Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.EntityId[] entities) cil managed
Public Function LockAsync (ParamArray entities As EntityId()) As Task(Of IDisposable)
abstract member LockAsync : Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.EntityId[] -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<IDisposable>

Docs.param: The entities whose locks should be acquired.
Docs.summary: Acquires one or more locks, for the specified entities.
Docs.returns: An IDisposable that releases the lock when disposed.
Docs.remarks: Locks can only be acquired if the current context does not hold any locks already.
Docs.exception: if the context already holds some locks.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Name { get; }
.property instance string Name
Public ReadOnly Property Name As String
member this.Name : string

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the current orchestration function.

MemberSignature.Value: public Guid NewGuid ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Guid NewGuid() cil managed
Public Function NewGuid () As Guid
abstract member NewGuid : unit -> Guid

Docs.summary: Creates a new GUID that is safe for replay within an orchestration or operation.
Docs.returns: The new value.
Docs.remarks: The default implementation of this method creates a name-based UUID using the algorithm from RFC 4122 4.3. The name input used to generate this value is a combination of the orchestration instance ID and an internally managed sequence number.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ParentInstanceId { get; }
.property instance string ParentInstanceId
Public ReadOnly Property ParentInstanceId As String
member this.ParentInstanceId : string

Docs.summary: Gets the parent instance ID of the currently executing sub-orchestration.
Docs.value: The ID of the parent orchestration of the current sub-orchestration instance. The value will be available only in sub-orchestrations.
Docs.remarks: The parent instance ID is generated and fixed when the parent orchestrator function is scheduled. It can be either auto-generated, in which case it is formatted as a GUID, or it can be user-specified with any format.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetCustomStatus(object customStatusObject) cil managed
Public Sub SetCustomStatus (customStatusObject As Object)
abstract member SetCustomStatus : obj -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON-serializeable value to use as the orchestrator function's custom status.
Docs.summary: Sets the JSON-serializeable status of the current orchestrator function.
Docs.remarks: The value is serialized to JSON and will be made available to the orchestration status query APIs. The serialized JSON value must not exceed 16 KB of UTF-16 encoded text.

Public Function StartNewOrchestration (functionName As String, input As Object, Optional instanceId As String = Nothing) As String
abstract member StartNewOrchestration : string * obj * string -> string

Docs.param: The name of the orchestrator function to call.
the input to pass to the orchestrator function.
optionally, an instance id for the orchestration. By default, a random GUID is used.
Docs.summary: Schedules a orchestration function named for execution./>. Any result or exception is ignored (fire and forget).
Docs.returns: The instance id of the new orchestration.
Docs.exception: The specified function does not exist, is disabled, or is not an orchestrator function.

Docs.param: The name of the event to wait for.
Docs.summary: Waits asynchronously for an event to be raised with name .
Docs.returns: A durable task that completes when the external event is received.
Docs.remarks: External clients can raise events to a waiting orchestration instance using with the object parameter set to null.
